body.name: Acer Aspire 3 A315-24P-R7VH Slim Laptop | 15.6" Full HD IPS Display | AMD Ryzen 3 7320U Quad-Core Processor | AMD Radeon Graphics | 8GB LPDDR5 | 128GB NVMe SSD | Wi-Fi 6 | Windows 11 Home in S Mode
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Amazon Warehouse and Fulfilled by Amazon.
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Thursday, February 15. Order within 15 hrs 50 mins
features: Purposeful Design: Travel with ease and look great doing it with the Aspire's 3 thin, light design.
Ready-to-Go Performance: The Aspire 3 is ready-to-go with the latest AMD Ryzen 3 7320U Processor with Radeon Graphics—ideal for the entire family, with performance and productivity at the core.
Visibly Stunning: Experience sharp details and crisp colors on the 15.6" Full HD IPS display with 16:9 aspect ratio and narrow bezels.
Internal Specifications: 8GB LPDDR5 Onboard Memory; 128GB NVMe solid-state drive storage to store your files and media

The HD front-facing camera uses Acer’s TNR (Temporal Noise Reduction) technology for high-quality imagery in low-light conditions. Acer PurifiedVoice technology with AI Noise Reduction filters out any extra sound for clear communication over online meetings.
Wireless Wi-Fi 6 Convenience: Maintain a strong, consistent wireless signal with Wi-Fi 6 (aka 802.11ax) and 2x2 MU-MIMO technology.

Improved Thermals: With a 78% increase in fan surface area, enjoy an improved thermal system and an additional 17% thermal capacity. Allowing for longer, more efficient work sessions while not plugged in.

Ports For All Your Accessories: 1 - USB Type-C Port USB 3.2 Gen 2 (up to 10 Gbps) DisplayPort over USB Type-C & USB Charging, 2 - USB 3.2 Gen 1 Ports, 1 - HDMI 2.1 Port with HDCP support, 1 - Headphone/Speaker/Line-Out Jack, DC-in for AC adapter
What's In the Box: Acer Aspire Laptop, AC Adapter, Power Cord
body.description: Choose the ready-to-go Aspire 3 with the latest Ryzen™ 7000 Series Processors made for practical multitasking and productivity. With ease-of-use at its core, this family-friendly laptop is ready when you are. This Aspire 3 can tackle any job no matter how complex. Creativity soars to new heights with sharp, crisp visuals showcased on the 15.6" Full HD IPS screen, while the thin bezel provides you with more space to work with wherever inspiration strikes. It’s the perfect companion to take with you wherever you go With Windows 11 Home in S mode, you’ll experience fast start-ups, a familiar yet expanded Start menu, and great new ways to get stuff done. And with automatic updates enabled, you get all the latest features and security hassle-free. Work, play and share all in one device (NX.KJBAA.001).

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Wireless Wi-Fi 6 Convenience Maintain a strong, consistent wireless signal with Wi-Fi 6 (aka 802.11ax) and 2x2 MU-MIMO technology. The strategic slot antenna placement helps maximize the portability and wireless performance of your laptop. Get a Fresh Perspective Family, friends, obsessions, music, creations—Windows 11 Home in S mode is the one place for it all. With a fresh new feel and tools that make it easier to be efficient, it has what you need for whatever’s next. Less noise, clutter, or chaos.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 29, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little machine for the price
reviews.reviewText: At the price point I think it's a straightforward buy, I bought it at 249.99. And the AMD Ryzen 3 7320U processor rocks with its performance, I was looking for a cheap Ryzen for the internal graphics processor they have. It's an awesome machine for lightweight old games, web browsing, and light stuff. It starts up in like 3 seconds after the screen turns on, the battery lasts some hours but I mainly used it connected to the power.The first boot-up was slow, I started it up without using the power cable, and it was really really slow, after connecting the power chord it became better and I was able to set up everything on Windows, it installed a bunch of updates and after that, the performance has been awesome, with the power chord and with only the battery. I assume at the first boot up it was overwhelmed by the number of updates and maybe it also needed some critical driver updates.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars perfect depending on needs
reviews.reviewText: Item: R3-7320UThis laptop should perform well for most uses except heavy gaming or video/photo editing. Overall for $292 this laptop cant be beat. If it lasts a year I will be extremely happy. Time will tell regarding longevity.Important tips: 11/5/23*You must update the system BIOS as soon as possible as there is a flaw which causes poor performance on battery power.*This item includes Windows 11 with "S" mode enabled. At the very least you need to remove this mode and without a microsoft account it is not straightforward to do so.*Install Windows 10 instead. Use the Windows ISO USB media creation tool. Save an image of the current SSD drive.. create a recovery thumb drive and then wipe the SSD. Doing a clean Win10 install from a USB stick does not require a new license key! The Win11 key automatically applies to the newly installed Windows 10 Home version. Go to the Acer website and download/install all the newest available drivers for your model.*Ditch (save) the power adapter and charge it instead with a USB-C - USB-C cable.Pros:Very acceptable screen quality for this price range.Measured USB and NVME speeds are goodDecently built and should hold up to light abuseWith proper drivers the CPU/GPU seem more than sufficient for light tasksGood battery life and seems to run cool with little fan noiseCons:There is no keyboard backlight despite the listing descriptionYou cannot upgrade this laptop. Internally there is no spot for a second drive and as far as I can tell no way to increase the RAM.The touchpad and buttons require more force than usual.No page up or page down buttonsNo ethernet or SD card portsHobbled Win11 OS requiring more than the average skill to get right

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 30, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Not Great, but Decent Enough
reviews.reviewText: My second ever Acer laptop. I had a small one in my younger years, and that thing struggle quite a long. This laptop is pretty much better in all it’s way, but that because of today technology. Honestly speaking, this laptop isn’t that great, but it’s good enough for what I need it for, which is good enough for me. For $300, and even less on sales. You can do some light office/college/business work, light browsing, and very very light gaming on low setting. Unless it’s an old MMO, you could probably get away with medium or higher, but don’t expect much. This thing may have “8” gb ram, but in honesty. You’re probably going to have around 3.5-4gb ram free, as window system will eat majority of it. My biggest complaint is that you can’t upgrade the ram, it’s sadly soldered on. Unlike the storage, which is upgradable, but do know you’ll have to reinstall window. The casing feels “light”, very light, enough to where to I don’t want to apply too much pressure as it might deform or bent it in a way, maybe cheap material. The display is….. uh do able? It’s very dim and the color is like off, very off, don’t expect to do any artsy stuff with correct colors. As for battery, it leaves a lot to be desire. Depending on what you’re doing you could be around 2-7hr battery life, so make sure to always keep it plugged in. The keyboard is fine, it’s nice to have a laptop with the side pad, it’s something I use for when I do light gaming. Other than, it’s a pretty all rounder budget laptop for a cheap price. Worth it for my use case, as I already have a gaming PC and a Steam Deck.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent purchase, except for 1 thing.
reviews.reviewText: This is an excellent, well built computer at this price point. Great screen, great (unlit) keyboard, fine camera too. My one small complaint is the battery life. It only lasts 2.5 hours. Maybe it's just this unit. I still love it and would definitely suggest it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 24, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Recommend: great hardware, but get rid of S mode, and remove bloatware
reviews.reviewText: Hardware choices, such as AMD CPU + onboard GPU, IPS screen, SSD, USB-C charging and battery life are all great for this price point.However, the RAM is soldered on, and therefore non-upgradable; for the technical, it is LPDDR5-5500, 8GB (2x4GB in dual-channel config). I am uncertain whether this will become a bottleneck, but so far, so good.The user manual suggests to initially cycle the battery 3 times from low battery to full to maximize the battery life long-term. The small pin on the charging connector seems likely to bend or break over time, but you can charge the laptop via the USB-C port as well, which should fix that problem if it ever becomes an issue, and is a cool feature to have.Physical construction seems pretty solid; it is made of plastic, but not flimsy, with a reasonably nice metal finish.Software wise, google how to take it out of S mode. Remove as much Windows 11 bloatware as you can. Or install Linux. Software drivers for Windows seem to work well so far. Haven't tested on Linux. Last BIOS update was 4 months ago which is a good sign in terms of support. This seems to be a fairly popular model, so I'm guessing that translates to better hardware support and bug-fixing in the long-term from Acer, but I could be wrong.Overall, quite pleased. Good hardware at a great price point. Solid construction. I think the designers at Acer made all the right trade-offs.Getting the software, I mean especially removing the cruft in Windows 11, is up to you.

The media could not be loaded. This Acer laptop delivers exceptional performance in a sleek, portable design. Its Intel Core processor ensures smooth multitasking without lag, and the battery life provides ample usage on a single charge. The vibrant display and crisp visuals enhance both work and entertainment. With a comfortable keyboard, responsive touchpad, ample storage, and diverse connectivity options, it's a versatile choice for everyday use. Overall, the Acer combines performance, portability, and functionality, making it a reliable companion for various tasks.

Tiene un rendimiento muy muy bueno, no se ha trabado para absolutamente nada, ahora quien se ha quedado lento es mi internet jaja, su calidad en todo sentido es excelente, lo que no me agrada del todo es su cargador, pero, sin duda es lo mejor para el precio, sobretodo aquí en México que para ese precio te ofrecen laptops con calidad horrible, de verdad que la volvería a encargar de nuevo, no se calienta, estéticamente es preciosa, su procesador es de lo mejores, la memoria sí que no es grande pero a la vez siento que está bien para que el procesador pueda rendir de la mejor manera, igual ya existen los discos duros, así que no hay pierde, si quieren algo de excelente calidad, estéticamente precioso y con un precio bajo, es la mejor opción ya que cuenta con prácticamente todo lo necesario casi para hacer cualquier cosa, no tuve tampoco ningún problema con el envío ni nada, la trajeron de Estados Unidos a México y todo muy bien (dato: la cámara también está preciosa cuando hay buena iluminación y el audio es muy bueno, no muy alto pero sí mucho mejor que el de mi laptop pasada sin duda).
Para mi que soy estudiante me parece bien, con photoshop es buena, si eres exigente quizá no sea lo que buscas pero para mi es muy buena y bonita, ademas llegó con cargador y caja original de acer.

I haven't used Windows for years, but I was looking for a low-cost laptop as a backup in case my MacBook was in for repair. I must have a working laptop at all times. I do notice the graphics on this laptop are inferior to my Mac, but that is to be expected for the price. I am not a gamer, nor will I use this laptop for extensive video editing. This is a great machine for social media surfing, emailing, blogging, word processing, etc. I video conference quite often, and the camera is fine. However, the volume is relatively low, even at its highest level. I had to lean in to hear if I was on a call with a soft-speaking individual. I downloaded a volume-amplifying app that helped. I know headphones would help, but I don't particularly appreciate wearing them.
La compré hace 4 meses y la verdad no me ha decepcionado, es rápida y para trabajo normal de oficina o para estudiantes (que no utilicen Autocad o cosas similares) está perfecta.
